===Origin===
According to the griot spirits of the [[Djalia]], the Orisha originated during immemorial times in the land that would become [[Wakanda]]. When the pilgrims who traveled to this land entered in conflict with the native beasts that lived on it, the [[Glossary:Originators|Originators]], the heroes that rose among the humans were ascended to gods on faith. These gods, the Orisha, were [[Thoth (Earth-616)|Thoth]], [[Kokou (Earth-616)|Kokou]], [[Mujaji (Earth-616)|Mujaji]], [[Ptah (Earth-616)|Ptah]], [[Nyami (Orisha) (Earth-616)|Nyami]] and [[Bast (Earth-616)|Bast]]. The humans and the Orisha defeated the originators and banished them to the [[Nether-Realms]] beyond a group of gates. As part of their duty, the Orisha became guardians of these gates.{{r|Black Panther #167}}

===Modern Era===
====Schism====
After the attack led by [[Tetu (Earth-616)|Tetu]]'s [[People (Earth-616)|army]] on [[Birnin Zana (Earth)|Birnin Zana]], [[T'Challa (Earth-616)|T'Challa]] wondered where the Gods had been in those times of trouble, and started to investigate on the matter.{{r|Black Panther Vol 6 13}}

In [[Kinamasi]], a faction of protesters abandoned their worship to the Orishas and preached the coming of a new god, [[Adversary (Earth-616)|Sefako]]. [[Yao (Wakandan) (Earth-616)|Counselor Yao]] of Kinamasi was certain that a schism was brewing.{{r|Black Panther Vol 6 16}} Others in Wakanda, such as in the [[Alkama Fields]] chose, on her return, to worship [[Hadari Yao]] (the "[[Walker of Clouds]]" in the old Alkamite tongue), the Goddess who preserves the balance of all natural things: [[Ororo Munroe (Earth-616)|Storm]], for her to defeat the [[Anansi (Race)|Anansi]], man-spiders of myth and legend. Once the Anansi were repelled, Ororo used the belief in her from the Alkamites to once again inspire confidence in their king and country,{{r|Black Panther Vol 6 17}} ultimately ascending to godhood herself.{{r|Black Panther #172}}

| Notes                   = * Both {{cl|Black Panther Vol 6 13}} and {{cl|Black Panther Vol 6 15|#15}} depict the Orishas of Wakanda as a group of five including [[Thoth (Earth-616)|Thoth]], [[Bast (Earth-616)|Bast]], [[Kokou (Earth-616)|Kokou]], [[Mujaji (Earth-616)|Mujaji]] and [[Ptah (Earth-616)|Ptah]]. Yet, in {{cl|Black Panther Vol 6 15|#15}}, [[T'Challa (Earth-616)|T'Challa]] mentions [[Nyami (Orisha) (Earth-616)|Nyami]], who could be Nyame, another name of [[Vodū]] [[Sky Father]] [[Buluku (Earth-616)|Buluku]].
* The previously introduced Orishas are part of the [[Ennead]] ([[Bast (Earth-616)|Bast]] and [[Ptah (Earth-616)|Ptah]]) and related gods ([[Thoth (Earth-616)|Thoth]]), forming the [[Gods of Egypt (Earth-616)|Gods]] of [[Egypt]], and not of the "classical" Orishas of [[Africa]], the [[Vodū]].
* Others first appeared as Gods of Wakanda, and haven't been confirmed as any known groups, though they are inspired by beings from [[Earth-1218|our reality]]'s [[Africa]]n mythologies, such as:
** [[Wikipedia:Kokou_(orisha)|Kokou]] is a "warrior [[Wikipedia:Orisha|Undergod]]" for the [[Wikipedia:Yoruba religion|Yoruba faith]] of [[Benin]].{{r|[[Wikipedia:Kokou_(orisha)|Kokou (orisha) at Wikipedia]]}}
** the [[Wikipedia:Rain Queen|Modjadji]] are "rain queens" from the [[Wikipedia:Lobedu people|Balobedu]]'s mythology.{{r|[http://www.mythencyclopedia.com/Mi-Ni/Mujaji.html Mujaji at Myth Encyclopedia]}}{{r|[[Wikipedia:Rain Queen|Rain Queen at Wikipedia]]}}
<!--* Part of the Orisha of Wakanda are Ennead (Bast, Ptah) or related (Thoth). The look of the 5 gods in #13 is Egyptian.
Kokou and Mujaji's species is unknown. If Nyami is Nyame/Buluku, he is a Vodu-->
* In addition to the main pantheon, other gods from Egypt are worshiped in Wakanda like the [[Hathor-Sekhmet (Earth-616)|Sekhmet]] (as Lion God) {{r|[[Wikipedia:Sekhmet|Sekhmet]]}}{{r|Thor & Hercules: Encyclopaedia Mythologica #1|; Lion God's entry}}<ref>[http://www.marvunapp.com/Appendix/liongod.htm Lion God at at Appendix to the Handbook of the Marvel Universe]</ref> and [[Sobek (Earth-616)|Sobek]] ([[Crocodile Cult (Earth-616)|Crocodile Cult]]) the gorilla gods worshiped by the [[Jabari Tribe (Earth-616)|Jabari tribe]] come from elsewhere in Africa: Before being Jabari, they worshiped[[Ngi (Earth-616)|Ngi]] from  [[:Wikipedia:Beti-Pahuin peoples|Yaoundé people]] ([[Cameroon]]).<ref>[http://www.marvunapp.com/Appendix4/jabariwhitegorilla.htm Jabari at Appendix to the Handbook of the Marvel Universe]</ref>{{r|Marvel Comics Presents Vol 3 2}}{{r|[[:Wikipedia:Zamba (god)|Zamba at Wikipedia]]}} Currently, the tribe is known to worship [[Ghekre (Earth-616)|Ghekre]] from [[Wikipedia:Baoulé people|Baoulé people]] ([[Ghana]]  and Ivory Coast) {{r|All-New Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z: Update #2|; [[Bast (Earth-616)|Panther God]]'s entry}}{{r|Thor & Hercules: Encyclopaedia Mythologica #1|; The [[Vodū]]'s entry}}<ref>[http://www.marvunapp.com/Appendix/liongod.htm Lion God at at Appendix to the Handbook of the Marvel Universe]</ref> and
